page.title: 10BRAYDON RESIDENTS
page.content: Although there is no village or social centre, there is a strong comm- unity spirit amongst the established residents. This encompasses both young and old and seems to generate from two main sources:the farming community and long-term familiarity. In this farming community all members of a family tend to work or at least help out on the farm, especially during busy periods. Farmers and their families also help neighbours in diff- icult times eg. poor weather in 1985 caused problems in harvesting and so they helped each other during the few dry periods to gather in crops. Many people have spent most of their lives in this community and know each other's families. Often the children of one family help the old of another family when a basic need arises.
